Bitpacketed Scalar

The section allows for the conversion of a integer to an array of Booleans (or visa versa).

What do you want to do?

Define bitpacking

To convert an integer to a Boolean array, you must first define the bitpacking. To do this, set the number of channels being bitpacked in Number of Channels and select Apply. Note: this will add the set number of channels under the bitpacked section. The zero index will be the top most channel. The next channel down will be index 1, etc. You can rename these channels to whatever you want and the index order will remain the same.

Remove Channel Bitpacking

Right click on the channel and select Disable Bitpacked. Note: this will remove any settings under the bitpacked section.
